  3. Matrix

Matrix¶

public class Matrix¶

A matrix is a rectangular array of numbers arranged by rows and columns. Formally, a matrix can be defined as \(A \in \mathbb{R}^{m\times n}\) where \(m\) is the number of rows and \(n\) is the number of columns. We access a value in a matrix as \(A_{i, j}\) where \(0 \leq i \leq m\) and \(0 \leq j \leq n\). We say that \(A\) is a row vector if \(m=1\) and that \(A\) is a column vector when \(n=1\). This is not the usual definition of a vector, but this simplifies the method definition, since internally they are defined with the Matrix class.

The Matrix is stored in column major scheme (see here). This is a decision project that makes possible to apply native code avoiding memory copy since we use BLAS.

Author:Charles Ferreira Gobber

See also: Operations, NativeOperations, JavaOperations, SimpleBlas

Constructors¶

Matrix¶

public Matrix(int numRows, int numColumns)¶

A constructor for Matrix.class. This allocate a Matrix with numRows by numColumns size.

Parameters:
  • numRows – Number of rows of the Matrix.
  • numColumns – Number of columns of the Matrix.

Matrix¶

public Matrix(double[] values, int numRows, int numColumns)¶

Another constructor for Matrix.class. This allocate a Matrix with numRows by numColumns size. This receives a vector stored in column major scheme (see here).

Parameters:
  • values – A vector of double values.
  • numRows – Number of rows of the Matrix.
  • numColumns – Number of columns of the Matrix.

Matrix¶

public Matrix(double[] values, int numRows, int numColumns, boolean deep)¶

Another constructor for Matrix.class. This allocate a Matrix with numRows by numColumns size. This receives a vector stored in column major scheme (see here).

Parameters:
  • values – A vector of double values.
  • numRows – Number of rows of the Matrix.
  • numColumns – Number of columns of the Matrix.
  • deep – A boolean parameter, if true the values vector is cloned, is not cloned otherwise.

Matrix¶

public Matrix(double[][] values)¶

Another constructor for Matrix.class. This method copies the Matrix values[][]. This stores a vector in column major scheme (see here).

Parameters:
  • values – A Matrix of double values.

Methods¶

T¶

public Matrix T()¶

This method returns the transposition of the Matrix, i.e., \(C=A^T\), where \(C\) is allocated internally.

Returns:A Matrix \(C\) that is \(A^T\).

T¶

public Matrix T(Matrix C)¶

This method returns the transposition of the Matrix, i.e., \(C=A^T\), where \(C\) is passed by parameter.

Parameters:
  • A – Matrix \(C\).
Returns:

A Matrix \(C\) that is \(A^T\).

argmax¶

public Matrix argmax(int axis)¶

argmin¶

public Matrix argmin(int axis)¶

biggerthen¶

public Matrix biggerthen(double t)¶

This method returns a binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), C_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} > t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold and \(C\) is a Matrix allocated inside the method.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) with the binary comparison.

biggerthen¶

public Matrix biggerthen(double t, Matrix C)¶

This method returns a binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), C_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} > t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold and \(C\) is a Matrix passed by parameter.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) with the binary comparison.

biggertheni¶

public Matrix biggertheni(double t)¶

This method returns a in place binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), A_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} > t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) with the binary comparison.

column¶

public Matrix column(int column)¶

This method returns a given column of the Matrix. This method implements the following operation:

\[\forall r=1,\ldots,m,~ C_{r,c}=A_{r,c},\]

where \(1\leq c\leq n\) is the column and \(C\) is a Matrix allocated inside the method.

Parameters:
  • column – A column of \(A\)
Returns:

A column Matrix (or a vector) of a given column.

column¶

public Matrix column(int column, Matrix C)¶

This method returns a given column of the Matrix, but it writes the values in the Matrix \(C\). This method implements the following operation:

\[\forall r=1,\ldots,m,~ C_{r,c}=A_{r,c},\]

where \(1\leq c\leq n\) is the column and \(C\) is a Matrix passed by parameter.

Parameters:
  • column – A column of \(A\)
  • C – A Matrix to store the column of \(A\)
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) filled by the given column of \(A\)

copy¶

public Matrix copy()¶

This method copies the Matrix.

Returns:Returns a copy of the instantiated Matrix.

div¶

public void div(int row, int col, double value)¶

This method divides the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=\frac{A_{r, c}}{v},\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows, \(c\) is the number of columns and \(v\) is the value.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to divides the value stored in (row, col).

div¶

public void div(int pos, double value)¶

This method divides the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=\frac{A_{r, c}}{v},\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to divides the value stored in (row, col).

div¶

public Matrix div(Matrix B, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the point wise division between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = \frac{A}{B}\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to divide with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

div¶

public Matrix div(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the point wise division between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = \frac{A}{B}\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to divide with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

div¶

public Matrix div(double value)¶

This method returns the scalar division between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = \frac{A}{v}\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to divide with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

div¶

public Matrix div(double value, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the scalar division between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = \frac{A}{v}\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to divide with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

divi¶

public Matrix divi(double value)¶

This method returns the in place scalar division between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A - v\]

where \(A\) is the in place scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to divide with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place scalar division between \(A\) and \(v\).

divi¶

public Matrix divi(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the in place point wise division between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = \frac{A}{B}\]

where \(A\) is the in place point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to divide with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place point wise division between \(A\) and \(B\).

fill¶

public Matrix fill(double value)¶

This method fills the Matrix by value. This method implements the following operation:

\[\forall (r, c), A_{r,c}=v,\]

where \(v\) is a value to fill \(A\).

Parameters:
  • value – The value to fill the Matrix.

get¶

public double get(int pos)¶

This method return a value of the Matrix from pos.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
Returns:

Value of the position pos.

get¶

public double get(int row, int col)¶

This method return a value of the Matrix from a position (row, col).

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
Returns:

Value of the position (row, col).

getData¶

public double[] getData()¶

This method returns the data that represents the Matrix.

Returns:The vector of Matrix values.

getSeparator¶

public String getSeparator()¶

This method returns the separator of the Matrix.

Returns:Returns the separator. Default is “;”

head¶

public void head(int numRows, int numColumns, String format)¶

This method prints the Matrix given a maximum number of (numRows, numColumns) and a given format.

Parameters:
  • numRows – The maximum number of rows.
  • numColumns – The maximum number of columns.
  • format – The format to print the Matrix.

head¶

public void head(int numRows, int numColumns)¶

This method prints the Matrix given a maximum number of (numRows, numColumns) and the format “[%e]”.

Parameters:
  • numRows – The maximum number of rows.
  • numColumns – The maximum number of columns.

head¶

public void head()¶

This method prints the first 6 lines of the Matrix, or numRows if 6 > numRows.

head¶

public void head(int numRows)¶

This method prints the first numRows lines of the Matrix, or this.numRows if numRows > this.numRows.

Parameters:
  • numRows – Number of rows to be printed.

isColVector¶

public boolean isColVector()¶

This method tests if a Matrix is a column vector or not.

Returns:Returns true if the Matrix is a column vector and false otherwise.

isMatrix¶

public boolean isMatrix()¶

This method tests if a Matrix is a matrix.

Returns:Returns true if the Matrix is a matrix and false otherwise.

isRowVector¶

public boolean isRowVector()¶

This method tests if a Matrix is a row vector or not.

Returns:Returns true if the Matrix is a row vector and false otherwise.

isScalar¶

public boolean isScalar()¶

This method tests if a Matrix is a scalar or not.

Returns:Returns true if the Matrix is a scalar and false otherwise.

length¶

public int length()¶

This method returns the length of the Matrix.

Returns:The length of the Matrix (numRows x numColumns).

lessthen¶

public Matrix lessthen(double t)¶

This method returns a binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), C_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} < t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold and \(C\) is a Matrix passed by parameter.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) with the binary comparison.

lessthen¶

public Matrix lessthen(double t, Matrix C)¶

This method returns a binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), C_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} < t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold and \(C\) is a Matrix allocated inside the method.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) with the binary comparison.

lesstheni¶

public Matrix lesstheni(double t)¶

This method returns a in place binary Matrix of the following comparison:

\[\begin{split}\forall (r, c), A_{r, c} = \begin{cases} 1,& \text{ if } A_{r, c} < t,\\ 0,& \text{ otherwise }\\ \end{cases}\end{split}\]

where \(t \in \mathbb{R}\) is a threshold.

Parameters:
  • t – The value of threshold.
Returns:

The in place Matrix \(A\) with the binary comparison.

minus¶

public void minus(int row, int col, double value)¶

This method subtracts the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}-v,\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows, \(c\) is the number of columns and \(v\) is the value.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to subtracts the value stored in (row, col).

minus¶

public void minus(int pos, double value)¶

This method subtracts the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}-v,\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to subtracts the value stored in (row, col).

minus¶

public Matrix minus(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the point wise subtraction between two Matrix. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE and \(B\) is not a scalar, and no native otherwise. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A - B\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to subtract with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

minus¶

public Matrix minus(Matrix B, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the point wise subtraction between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A - B\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to subtract with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

minus¶

public Matrix minus(double value)¶

This method returns the scalar subtraction between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A - v\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to subtract with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

minus¶

public Matrix minus(double value, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the scalar subtraction between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A - v\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to subtract with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

minusi¶

public Matrix minusi(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the in place point wise subtraction between two Matrix. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE and \(B\) is not a scalar, and no native otherwise. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A - B\]

where \(A\) is the in place point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to subtract with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place point wise subtraction between \(A\) and \(B\).

minusi¶

public Matrix minusi(double value)¶

This method returns the in place scalar subtraction between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A - v\]

where \(A\) is the in place scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to subtract with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place scalar subtraction between \(A\) and \(v\).

mul¶

public void mul(int row, int col, double value)¶

This method multiplies the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}*v,\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows, \(c\) is the number of columns and \(v\) is the value.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to multiplies the value stored in (row, col).

mul¶

public void mul(int pos, double value)¶

This method multiplies the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}*v,\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to multiplies the value stored in (row, col).

mul¶

public Matrix mul(Matrix B, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the point wise multiplication between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A * B\]

where \(C\) (passes by parameter) is the point wise multiplication between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to multiplies with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store \(A*B\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise multiplication between \(A\) and \(B\).

mul¶

public Matrix mul(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the point wise multiplication between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A * B\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the point wise multiplication between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to multiplies with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store \(A*B\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise multiplication between \(A\) and \(B\).

mul¶

public Matrix mul(double value)¶

This method returns the scalar multiplication between two \(A\) and \(v\). This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A * v\]

where \(v\) is a value and \(C\) (allocated internally) is the scalar multiplication between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A value to multiplies with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar multiplication between \(A\) and \(v\).

mul¶

public Matrix mul(double value, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the scalar multiplication between two \(A\) and \(v\). This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A * v\]

where \(v\) is a value and \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the scalar multiplication between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A value to multiplies with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store \(A*v\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is scalar multiplication between \(A\) and \(v\).

muli¶

public Matrix muli(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the in place point wise multiplication between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A * B\]
Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to multiplies with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place point wise multiplication between \(A\) and \(B\).

muli¶

public Matrix muli(double value)¶

This method returns the in place scalar multiplication between two \(A\) and \(v\). This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A * v\]

where \(v\) is a value.

Parameters:
  • value – A value to multiplies with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place scalar multiplication between \(A\) and \(v\).

neg¶

public void neg(int row, int col)¶

This method negates the value stored in Matrix position (row, col). This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}*-1,\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows and \(c\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.

neg¶

public void neg(int pos)¶

This method negates the value stored in Matrix position (row, col). This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}*-1,\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.

one¶

public Matrix one()¶

This method fills the Matrix with 1s. This method implements the following operation: \(\forall (r, c), A_{r,c}=1\)

ones¶

public static Matrix ones(int numRows, int numColumns)¶

plus¶

public void plus(int row, int col, double value)¶

This method adds the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}+v,\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows, \(c\) is the number of columns and \(v\) is the value.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to adds the value stored in (row, col).

plus¶

public void plus(int pos, double value)¶

This method adds the value stored in Matrix position (row, col) by a value passed for parameter. This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}+v,\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to adds the value stored in (row, col).

plus¶

public Matrix plus(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the point wise summation between two Matrix. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE and \(B\) is not a scalar, and no native otherwise. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A + B\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to sum with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

plus¶

public Matrix plus(Matrix B, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the in place point wise summation between two Matrix. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A + B\]

where \(C\) is the point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to sum with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

plus¶

public Matrix plus(double value)¶

This method returns the scalar summation between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A + v\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to sum with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

plus¶

public Matrix plus(double value, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the scalar summation between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[C = A + v\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to sum with \(A\).
  • C – A Matrix \(C\) to store the scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) that is the scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

plusi¶

public Matrix plusi(Matrix B)¶

This method returns the in place point wise summation between two Matrix. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE, and no native otherwise. This supports broadcasting operations. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A + B\]

where \(A\) is the in place point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

Parameters:
  • B – A Matrix \(B\) to sum with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place point wise summation between \(A\) and \(B\).

plusi¶

public Matrix plusi(double value)¶

This method returns the in place scalar summation between a Matrix and a value. This method implements the following operation:

\[A = A + v\]

where \(A\) is the in place scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

Parameters:
  • value – A scalar to sum with \(A\).
Returns:

The Matrix \(A\) that is the in place scalar summation between \(A\) and \(v\).

pow2¶

public void pow2(int row, int col)¶

This method squares the value stored in Matrix position (row, col). This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}^2,\]

where \(r\) is the number of rows and \(c\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.

pow2¶

public void pow2(int pos)¶

This method squares the value stored in Matrix position (row, col). This method implements the following operation:

\[A_{r,c}=A_{r, c}^2,\]

where \(r=\lfloor \frac{pos}{m} \rfloor\) is the number of rows and \(c=(pos\equiv m)\) is the number of columns.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.

randnorm¶

public Matrix randnorm()¶

row¶

public Matrix row(int row)¶

This method returns a given row of the Matrix. This method implements the following operation:

\[\forall c=1,\ldots,n,~ C_{1,c}=A_{r,c},\]

where \(r\) is the row and \(C\) is a Matrix allocated inside the method.

Parameters:
  • row – A row of \(A\)
Returns:

A row Matrix (or a vector) of a given row.

row¶

public Matrix row(int row, Matrix C)¶

This method returns a given row of the Matrix, but it writes the values in the Matrix \(C\). This method implements the following operation:

\[\forall c=1,\ldots,n,~ C_{r,c}=A_{r,c},\]

where \(1\leq r\leq m\) is the row and \(C\) is a Matrix passed by parameter.

Parameters:
  • row – A row of \(A\)
  • C – A Matrix to store the row of \(A\)
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) filled by the given row of \(A\)

set¶

public void set(int pos, double value)¶

This method sets a value of the Matrix from a position pos.

Parameters:
  • pos – A valid position of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to be stored in pos.

set¶

public void set(int row, int col, double value)¶

This method sets a value of the Matrix from a position (row, col).

Parameters:
  • row – A valid row of the Matrix.
  • col – A valid col of the Matrix.
  • value – A value to be stored in (row, col).

public void setData(double[] data)¶

This method sets the data that represents the Matrix.

Parameters:
  • data – A vector of doubles.

public void setSeparator(String separator)¶

This method sets the separator of the Matrix.

Parameters:
  • separator – A String separator useful to save store a Matrix as a file.

This method returns a string with the shape of the Matrix.

Returns:Returns (numRows, numColumns)

sum¶

public Matrix sum()¶

This method returns the sum of all elements of the Matrix. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE, and no native otherwise. This method implements the following operation:

\[s = \sum_{r=1}^m\sum_{c=1}^nA_{r, c}\]

where \(s\) is the sum of \(A\).

Returns:The Matrix \(C\) of the sum of all elements of \(A\)

sum¶

public Matrix sum(int axis)¶

This method returns the sum of all elements of the Matrix of a given axis. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE, and no native otherwise. This method implements the following operation:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} C_{1, c} &= \sum_{r=1}^mA_{r, c}, 1\leq c \leq n, \text{ if } axis=0\\ C_{r, 1} &= \sum_{c=1}^nA_{r, c}, 1\leq r \leq m, \text{ if } axis=1 \end{align}\end{split}\]

where \(C\) (allocated internally) is the sum of a given axis of \(A\).

Parameters:
  • axis – A valid axis, 0 or 1.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) the sum of a given axis of \(A\)

sum¶

public Matrix sum(int axis, Matrix C)¶

This method returns the sum of all elements of the Matrix of a given axis. It is computed natively if Options.operations = Operations.NATIVE, and no native otherwise. This method implements the following operation:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} C_{1, c} &= \sum_{r=1}^mA_{r, c}, 1\leq c \leq n, \text{ if } axis=0\\ C_{r, 1} &= \sum_{c=1}^nA_{r, c}, 1\leq r \leq m, \text{ if } axis=1 \end{align}\end{split}\]

where \(C\) (passed by parameter) is the sum of a given axis of \(A\).

Parameters:
  • axis – A valid axis, 0 or 1.
  • A – Matrix \(C\) to store the sum.
Returns:

The Matrix \(C\) the sum of a given axis of \(A\).

zero¶

public Matrix zero()¶

This method fills the Matrix with 0s. This method implements the following operation: \(\forall (r, c), A_{r,c}=0\)
